intro: Leptormus tenellus, commonly known as the slender flatworm, is a species of flatworm belonging to the family Dendrocoelidae. It is a small, free-living flatworm typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds and streams. The organism has a distinctive elongated, flattened body with a coloration that varies from translucent to pale yellow. It lacks a true digestive system and absorbs nutrients through its skin. Leptormus tenellus plays a minor role in aquatic ecosystems as a predator of small invertebrates.
